data.name: (Luke) Thuldus Blackblade
data.hair: Dirty and matted long ginger hair and beard.

definition.name: Soldier
definition.description:
Ability Scores: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution
Feat: Savage Attacker
Skill Proficiencies: Athletics and Intimidation
Tool Proficiency: Choose one kind of Gaming Set
Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) Spear, Shortbow, 20 Arrows, Gaming Set (same as above), Healer's Kit, Quiver, Traveler's Clothes, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP

You began training for war as soon as you reached adulthood and carry precious few memories of life before you took up arms. Battle is in your blood. Sometimes you catch yourself reflexively performing the basic fighting exercises you learned first. Eventually, you put that training to use on the battlefield, protecting the realm by waging war.

Ability Scores: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution
Feat: Savage Attacker

race.description:
Dwarves were raised from the earth in the elder days by a deity of the forge.

Dwarf Traits
Darkvision, Dwarven Resilience, Dwarven Toughness, Stonecunning

definition.name: Darkvision
definition.description: You have Darkvision with a range of 120 feet.
definition.snippet: You have Darkvision with a range of 120 ft.

definition.name: Creature Type
definition.description: You are a Humanoid.
definition.snippet: You are a Humanoid.

definition.name: Size
definition.description: You are Medium (about 4–5 feet tall).
definition.snippet: You are Medium.

definition.name: Speed
definition.description: Your speed is 30 ft.
definition.snippet: Your speed is 30 ft.

definition.name: Dwarven Resilience
definition.description: You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.
definition.snippet: You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.

definition.name: Dwarven Toughness
definition.description: Your Hit Point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.
definition.snippet: Your HP maximum increases by {{characterlevel}}.

definition.name: Stonecunning
definition.description:
As a Bonus Action, you gain Tremorsense with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching a stone surface to use this Tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.

You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
definition.snippet:
As a Bonus Action, you gain Tremorsense with a range of 60 ft. for 10 minutes. You must be on or touching a natural or worked stone surface to use this Tremorsense.

You can use this Bonus Action {{proficiency#unsigned}} times per Long Rest.

definition.name: Ability Score Increases
definition.description: When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one score by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase three scores by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.
definition.snippet: When determining your character’s ability scores, increase one score by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase three scores by 1.

definition.name: Languages
definition.description:
Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table. Knowledge of a language means your character can communicate in it, read it, and write it. Your class and other features might also give you languages.

The Standard Languages table lists languages that are widespread on D&D worlds. Every player character knows Common, which originated in the planar metropolis of Sigil, the hub of the multiverse. The other standard languages originated with the first members of the most prominent species in the worlds of D&D and have since spread widely.

Standard Languages
1d12 Language Origin
— Common Sigil
1 Common Sign Language Sigil
2 Draconic Dragons
3-4 Dwarvish Dwarves
5-6 Elvish Elves
7 Giant Giants
8 Gnomish Gnomish
9 Goblin Goblinoids
10-11 Halfling Halflings
12 Orc Orcs
definition.snippet: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table. Knowledge of a language means your character can communicate in it, read it, and write it.

notes.personalPossessions: 2 tarnished gold wedding bands on a sturdy chain
notes.enemies: Disgust for orc kind and orc simpathisers
notes.backstory:
From a young age Thuldus showed promise with an axe and keen understanding for battle. His father, a major figure in the mountains armies, trained a young Thuldus in warfare and the ways of the barbarian.

In his teen years he rose through the ranks and claimed many victory's and in many cases been key to turning the tide in pivotal battles.

As dedicated as he was to serving the mountain and it's defences Thuldus was as susceptible to love and desire as anyone else, especially when it came to a young barmaid named Ellie Halfmountain.

As young love blossomed, duty began to be neglected and resentment from his father towards Ellie arose. The day came where Thuldus and Ellie expressed desire to be wed and for Thuldus to retire from warfare only to be denied this by his father being told 'to neglect your duties for love is to betray the mountain and it's people' and 'if you carry on down this path you shall be disowned and Stripped of all titles.'

With rage and resentment in his heart Thuldus made the difficult decision to leave the safety of the mountain in search of a peaceful life and begin a family.

2 years on they young couple had achieved their dream. In the shadow of a neighbouring mountain amongst a small forest the couple had built a home and had a child. A cute baby girl that looked like her mother but had her fathers fiery red hair. Finally the couple were happy and at peace. Until an Orc raiding party on its way to a dwarven village passed through the forest. 

Believing his family to be safe and that no harm could befall them in the safety of the forest Thuldus had ventured out on a hunt as he would do weekly. The smell had reached him before the sight.. fire.. the forest was ablaze. He rushed back through smoke and flames to the opening In the trees where the couples log cabin once stood to find it smouldering and caved in and on the ground in front of the ruins lay a lonely figure. Thuldus roared into the sky holding the lifeless body of his beloved Ellie, his baby daughter was nowhere to be found.

He spent the next 5 years in vain searching for any sign on the orc troop that marched through the forest that day. With no leads and no witnesses desire for revenge gave way to despair and as time past Thuldus turned to drink as his only comfort.

15 years on Thuldus now spends his time as a mercenary of sorts to fund his drinking habits. A quiet rage over his lost life still simmers behind his eyes but the desire for revenge is all but gone.

definition.name: Handaxe
definition.description:
Proficiency with a Handaxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it.

Vex. If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

properties.name: Light
properties.description: When you take the [action]Attack[/action] action on your turn and attack with a Light weapon, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn. That extra attack must be made with a different Light weapon, and you don’t add your ability modifier to the extra attack’s damage unless that modifier is negative. For example, you can attack with a [items]Shortsword[/items] in one hand and a [items]Dagger[/items] in the other using the [action]Attack[/action] action and a Bonus Action, but you don’t add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll of the Bonus Action unless that modifier is negative.

properties.name: Thrown
properties.description: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack, and you can draw that weapon as part of the attack. If the weapon is a Melee weapon, use the same ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls that you use for a melee attack with that weapon.

properties.name: Vex
properties.description: If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

definition.name: Greataxe
definition.description:
Proficiency with a Greataxe allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

This weapon has the following mastery property. To use this property, you must have a feature that lets you use it.

Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using this weapon, you can make a melee attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

properties.name: Heavy
properties.description: You have [rules]Disadvantage[/rules] on attack rolls with a Heavy weapon if it’s a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn’t at least 13 or if it’s a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn’t at least 13.

properties.name: Two-Handed
properties.description: A Two-Handed weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

properties.name: Cleave
properties.description: If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using this weapon, you can make a melee attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon's damage, but don't add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

definition.name: Backpack
definition.description: A Backpack holds up to 30 pounds within 1 cubic foot. It can also serve as a saddlebag.

definition.name: Oil
definition.description:
You can douse a creature, object, or space with Oil or use it as fuel, as detailed below.

Dousing a Creature or an Object. When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing an Oil flask. Target one creature or object within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or be covered in oil. If the target takes Fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an extra 5 Fire damage from burning oil.

Dousing a Space. You can take the Utilize action to pour an Oil flask on level ground to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. If lit, the oil burns until the end of the turn 2 rounds from when the oil was lit (or 12 seconds) and deals 5 Fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Fuel. Oil serves as fuel for Lamps and Lanterns. Once lit, a flask of Oil burns for 6 hours in a Lamp or Lantern. That duration doesn’t need to be consecutive; you can extinguish the burning Oil (as a Utilize action) and rekindle it again until it has burned for a total of 6 hours.

definition.name: Rations
definition.description: Rations consist of travel-ready food, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. See “Malnutrition” for the risks of not eating.

definition.name: Rope
definition.description:
As a Utilize action, you can tie a knot with Rope if you succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. The Rope can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check.

You can bind an unwilling creature with the Rope only if the creature has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. If the creature’s legs are bound, the creature has the Restrained condition until it escapes. Escaping the Rope requires the creature to make a successful DC 15 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action.

definition.name: Bedroll
definition.description: A Bedroll sleeps one Small or Medium creature. While in a Bedroll, you automatically succeed on saving throws against extreme cold (see the Dungeon Master’s Guide).

definition.name: Tinderbox
definition.description: A Tinderbox is a small container holding flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a Candle, Lamp, Lantern, or Torch—or anything else with exposed fuel—takes a Bonus Action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

definition.name: Torch
definition.description: A Torch burns for 1 hour, casting Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. When you take the Attack action, you can attack with the Torch, using it as a Simple Melee weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1 Fire damage.

definition.name: Waterskin
definition.description: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don’t drink sufficient water, you risk dehydration.

definition.name: Barbarian
definition.description:
A Fierce Warrior of Primal Rage

Barbarians are mighty warriors who are powered by primal forces of the multiverse that manifest as a Rage.

Primary Ability: Strength
Hit Point Die: D12
Saves: Strength & Constitution
definition.equipmentDescription:
Choose A or B:
(A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or
(B) 75 GP

classFeatures.name: Rage
classFeatures.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

classFeatures.name: Unarmored Defense
classFeatures.description: While you aren’t wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeatures.name: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

classFeatures.name: Danger Sense
classFeatures.description: You gain an uncanny sense of when things aren’t as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge perils. You have Advantage on Dexterity saving throws unless you have the Incapacitated condition.

classFeatures.name: Reckless Attack
classFeatures.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with increased ferocity. When you make your first attack roll on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you Advantage on attack rolls using Strength until the start of your next turn, but attack rolls against you have Advantage during that time.

classFeatures.name: Barbarian Subclass
classFeatures.description: You gain a Barbarian subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Barbarian levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass’s features that are of your Barbarian level or lower.

classFeatures.name: Primal Knowledge
classFeatures.description:
You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeatures.name: Extra Attack
classFeatures.description: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeatures.name: Fast Movement
classFeatures.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

classFeatures.name: Feral Instinct
classFeatures.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

classFeatures.name: Instinctive Pounce
classFeatures.description: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.

classFeatures.name: 8: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 12 and 16.

classFeatures.name: Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description:
If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn’t have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

Forceful Blow. The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Hamstring Blow. The target’s Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time—the most recent one.

classFeatures.name: Relentless Rage
classFeatures.description:
Your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, your Hit Points instead change to a number equal to twice your Barbarian level.

Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

classFeatures.name: 12: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian level 16.

classFeatures.name: Improved Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description:
You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

Staggering Blow. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and it can’t make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Sundering Blow. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An attack roll can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.

classFeatures.name: Persistent Rage
classFeatures.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

classFeatures.name: 16: Ability Score Improvement
classFeatures.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeatures.name: Improved Brutal Strike
classFeatures.description: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

classFeatures.name: Indomitable Might
classFeatures.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

classFeatures.name: Epic Boon
classFeatures.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeatures.name: Primal Champion
classFeatures.description: You embody primal power. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.

classFeatures.name: Core Barbarian Traits
classFeatures.description:
As a Level 1 Character:

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Barbarian Traits table.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Saving Throw Proficiencies Strength and Constitution
Skill Proficiencies Choose 2: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival
Weapon Proficiencies Simple and Martial weapons
Armor Training Light and Medium armor and Shields
Starting Equipment Choose A or B: (A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or (B) 75 GP

classFeatures.name: 4: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

classFeatures.name: 10: Weapon Mastery
classFeatures.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of another kind of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of your chosen weapon choices.

definition.name: Rage
definition.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

definition.description: You gain a Barbarian subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Barbarian levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass’s features that are of your Barbarian level or lower.

definition.name: Primal Knowledge
definition.description:
You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.
definition.snippet:
You gain proficiency in another Barbarian skill of your choice.

While Raging, whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Str. check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

definition.name: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 8, 12, and 16.

definition.name: Extra Attack
definition.description: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
definition.snippet: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

definition.name: Fast Movement
definition.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.
definition.snippet: Your speed increases by 10 ft. while you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

definition.name: Feral Instinct
definition.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.
definition.snippet: You have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

definition.name: Instinctive Pounce
definition.description: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.
definition.snippet: As part of the Bonus Action you take to enter your Rage, you can move up to half your Speed.

definition.name: 8: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian levels 12 and 16.

definition.name: Brutal Strike
definition.description:
If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn’t have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

Forceful Blow. The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Hamstring Blow. The target’s Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a time—the most recent one.
definition.snippet: If you use Reckless attack, you can forgo Advantage on one Strength-based attack of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll must not have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra {{scalevalue}}d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, you can cause {{scalevalue}} Brutal Strike effect(s) of your choice.

definition.name: Relentless Rage
definition.description:
Your Rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 Hit Points while your Rage is active and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, your Hit Points instead change to a number equal to twice your Barbarian level.

Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a Short or Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.
definition.snippet:
If you drop to 0 HP while Raging and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Con. saving throw. If you succeed, your HP instead becomes {{2*classlevel}}.

Each subsequent use of this feature increases the DC by 5. After you finish a Short/Long Rest, the DC resets to 10.

definition.name: 12: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Barbarian level 16.

definition.name: Improved Brutal Strike
definition.description:
You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options.

Staggering Blow. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and it can’t make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Sundering Blow. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus to the roll. An attack roll can gain only one Sundering Blow bonus.
definition.snippet: You learn two additional Brutal Strike effects: Staggering Blow and Sundering Blow.

definition.name: Persistent Rage
definition.description:
When you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage. After you regain uses of Rage in this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

In addition, your Rage is so fierce that it now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to do anything to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.
definition.snippet:
Once per Long Rest, when you roll Initiative, you can regain all expended uses of Rage.

In addition, your Rage now lasts for 10 minutes without you needing to take any additional actions to extend it from round to round. Your Rage ends early if you have the if you have the Unconscious condition (not just the Incapacitated condition) or don Heavy armor.

definition.name: 16: Ability Score Improvement
definition.description: You gain the Ability Score Improvement feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

definition.name: Improved Brutal Strike
definition.description: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.
definition.snippet: The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to 2d10 and you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.

definition.name: Indomitable Might
definition.description: If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.
definition.snippet: Your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw cannot be lower than {{abilityscore:str}}.

definition.name: Epic Boon
definition.description: You gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

definition.name: Primal Champion
definition.description: You embody primal power. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.
definition.snippet: Your Strength and Constitution increase by 4, and their maximum is now 25.

definition.name: Core Barbarian Traits
definition.description:
As a Level 1 Character:

  • Gain all the traits in the Core Barbarian Traits table.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Saving Throw Proficiencies Strength and Constitution
Skill Proficiencies Choose 2: Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, or Survival
Weapon Proficiencies Simple and Martial weapons
Armor Training Light and Medium armor and Shields
Starting Equipment Choose A or B: (A) Greataxe, 4 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, and 15 GP; or (B) 75 GP
definition.multiClassDescription:
As a Multiclass Character:

  • Gain the following traits from the Core Barbarian Traits table: Hit Point Die, proficiency with Martial weapons, and training with Shields.
  • Gain the Barbarian’s level 1 features.
Core Barbarian Traits
Primary Ability Strength
Hit Point Die D12 per Barbarian level
Weapon Proficiencies Martial weapons
Armor Training Shields

definition.name: Rage
definition.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

Select Activate Rage below to apply the effects from Rage. Deselect it to stop Raging.
definition.snippet: You can take a Bonus action to enter Rage if you aren’t wearing Heavy Armor. You can use Rage {{scalevalue}} times per Long Rest, and regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest. Activate Rage by clicking on this feature and selecting the drop down called Activate Rage. Deselect it to stop Raging.

definition.name: 4: Weapon Mastery
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

definition.name: 10: Weapon Mastery
definition.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of another kind of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of your chosen weapon choices.

definition.name: Weapon Mastery
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice, such as Greataxes and Handaxes. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.

When you reach certain Barbarian levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the Weapon Mastery column of the Barbarian Features table.

definition.name: Savage Attacker
definition.description:
Origin Feat

You’ve trained to deal particularly damaging strikes. Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon’s damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.
definition.snippet: Once per turn when you hit a target with a weapon, you can roll the weapon’s damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

definition.name: Soldier Ability Score Improvements
definition.description: The Soldier Background allows you to choose between Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. Increase one of these scores by 2 and another one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

While active, your Rage follows these rules:

    • You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing Damage.
    • When you make an attack using Strength and deal damage, you gain a {{(12+classlevel)/7#rounddown,min:2,signed}} bonus to damage.
    • You have Advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
    • You can’t maintain Concentration or cast spells.

Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, ending early if you don Heavy armor or have the Incapacitated condition. If your Rage is still active, you can extend your Rage by doing one of the following:

    • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
    • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
    • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.

definition.name: Greataxe (Cleave)
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Greataxes:

Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a Greataxe, you can make a melee attack roll with the Greataxe against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Greataxe’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
definition.snippet: Cleave. Once per turn, if you hit a creature with a melee attack using a Greataxe, you can make another melee attack with it against a second creature within 5 ft. of the first that’s within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Greataxe’s damage, but without your ability modifier (unless the modifier is negative).

definition.name: Handaxe (Vex)
definition.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Handaxes:

Vex. If you hit a creature with a Handaxe and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
definition.snippet: Vex. If you hit a creature with a Handaxe and deal damage to it, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

definition.name: Increase two scores (+2 / +1)
definition.description: Increase one of these scores by 2 and a different score by 1.

feat.label: Choose +2 to Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution
Choose +1 to Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution

race.name: Stonecunning (Tremorsense)
race.description:
As a Bonus Action, you gain [sense]Tremorsense[/sense] with a range of 60 feet for 10 minutes. You must be on a stone surface or touching a stone surface to use this Tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.

You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
race.snippet: You gain Tremorsense with a range of 60 ft. for 10 minutes. You must be on or touching a natural or worked stone surface to use this Tremorsense.

class.name: Rage (Enter)
class.description:
You can imbue yourself with a primal power called Rage, a force that grants you extraordinary might and resilience. You can enter it as a Bonus Action if you aren’t wearing Heavy armor.

You can enter your Rage the number of times shown for your Barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian Features table. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the [condition]Incapacitated[/condition] condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.
class.snippet: You can enter Rage if you aren’t wearing Heavy Armor. You can use Rage {{limiteduse}} times per Long Rest, and regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest.

class.name: Extend Rage
class.description:
While active, your Rage follows the rules below.

Damage Resistance. You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

Rage Damage. When you make an attack using Strength—with either a weapon or an Unarmed Strike—and deal damage to the target, you gain a bonus to the damage that increases as you gain levels as a Barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian Features table.

Strength Advantage. You have Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

No Concentration or Spells. You can’t maintain Concentration, and you can’t cast spells.

Duration. The Rage lasts until the end of your next turn, and it ends early if you don Heavy armor or have the [condition]Incapacitated[/condition] condition. If your Rage is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Rage for another round by doing one of the following:

  • Make an attack roll against an enemy.
  • Force an enemy to make a saving throw.
  • Take a Bonus Action to extend your Rage.

Each time the Rage is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Rage for up to 10 minutes.
class.snippet: As a Bonus Action, you can extend your Rage until the end of your next turn. You can maintain Rage for up to 10 minutes.

class.name: Rage: Primal Knowledge
class.description:
You gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the skill list available to Barbarians at level 1.

In addition, while your Rage is active, you can channel primal power when you attempt certain tasks; whenever you make an ability check using one of the following skills, you can make it as a Strength check even if it normally uses a different ability: [skill]Acrobatics[/skill], [skill]Intimidation[/skill], [skill]Perception[/skill], [skill]Stealth[/skill], or [skill]Survival[/skill]. When you use this ability, your Strength represents primal power coursing through you, honing your agility, bearing, and senses.
class.snippet: Whenever you make an Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, or Survival check, you can use your Str. modifier instead of the skill’s usual ability modifier.

feat.name: Cleave (Greataxe)
feat.description:
Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery property of Greataxes:

Cleave. If you hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a Greataxe, you can make a melee attack roll with the Greataxe against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Greataxe’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
feat.snippet: Cleave. Once per turn, if you hit a creature with a melee attack using a Greataxe, you can make another melee attack with it against a second creature within 5 ft. of the first that’s within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the Greataxe’s damage, but without your ability modifier (unless the modifier is negative).
